metadata.title: CVE-2022-48659 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mm/slub: fix to return errno if kmalloc() fails In create_unique_id(),kmalloc(, GFP_KERNEL) can fail due to out-of-memory, if it fails, returnerrno correctly rather than triggering panic via BUG_ON(); kernel BUG atmm/slub.c:5893! Internal error: Oops - BUG: 0 [#1] PREEMPT SMP Call trace:sysfs_slab_add+0x258/0x260 mm/slub.c:5973 __kmem_cache_create+0x60/0x118mm/slub.c:4899 create_cache mm/slab_common.c:229 [inline]kmem_cache_create_usercopy+0x19c/0x31c mm/slab_common.c:335kmem_cache_create+0x1c/0x28 mm/slab_common.c:390 f2fs_kmem_cache_createfs/f2fs/f2fs.h:2766 [inline] f2fs_init_xattr_caches+0x78/0xb4fs/f2fs/xattr.c:808 f2fs_fill_super+0x1050/0x1e0c fs/f2fs/super.c:4149mount_bdev+0x1b8/0x210 fs/super.c:1400 f2fs_mount+0x44/0x58fs/f2fs/super.c:4512 legacy_get_tree+0x30/0x74 fs/fs_context.c:610vfs_get_tree+0x40/0x140 fs/super.c:1530 do_new_mount+0x1dc/0x4e4fs/namespace.c:3040 path_mount+0x358/0x914 fs/namespace.c:3370 do_mountfs/namespace.c:3383 [inline] __do_sys_mount fs/namespace.c:3591 [inline]__se_sys_mount fs/namespace.c:3568 [inline] __arm64_sys_mount+0x2f8/0x408fs/namespace.c:3568

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48659` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-lowlatency - 4.4.0-258.292
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-lowlatency - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1136-kvm - 4.4.0-1136.146
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1173-aws - 4.4.0-1173.188
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1151-aws - 4.15.0-1151.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1146-gcp - 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1115-oracle - 4.15.0-1115.126~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-258.292').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.146').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1173.188').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1151.164~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1115.126~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
